item.title: Who won the 2018 NBA draft night trade? Mavericks or Hawks?
Who won the Luka Doncic-Trae Young trade?
item.description: library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.5 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.0 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggrepel) library(ggalt) ## Registered S3 methods overwritten by 'ggalt': ## method from ## grid.draw.absoluteGrob ggplot2 ## grobHeight.

item.title: Cleaning text homework
item.description: I am going to take the data given to me for this assignment and separate a column into new columns. I also would like to clean up the data to be easier to read and use for later projects. The first step is always to load the library tidyverse. I also added ggalt for future use. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.
